results.title: Tell me a story (Canberra) : Digital Storytelling project
results.brief_description: This compilation of eleven stories, created by Canberra locals, was the culmination of ACMI’s ‘Train the trainer’ workshops. The stories, mostly biographical, cover a wide range of topics but are mostly concerned with beloved family members and life changing events.
results.title_for_label: Tell me a story (Canberra) : Digital Storytelling project

results.title: Mamie & Maggie
results.creator_credit: Eulea Kiraly, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Eulea Kiraly pays tribute to her grandmothers Maggie and Mamie, who are a source of comfort, inspiration and resilience. This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with the Tuggeranong Arts Centre.

results.title: A Lesson in loneliness
results.brief_description: When Christian started feeling depressed about his life, he went backpacking around Asia. He recalls his journey through his friendships, self-discovery and loneliness.
results.description: When Christian started feeling depressed about his life, he went backpacking around Asia. He recalls his journey through his friendships, self-discovery and loneliness.

results.title: Proceed to the blue desk please
results.creator_credit: Simone West, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Simone West juxtaposes the urgency of processing child patients that are suffering from burns with the sense of urgency that assail the loved ones that want everything to be ok.

results.title: Home for four days, gone for four years
results.creator_credit: Sarah Rood, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Sarah Rood retells the whirlwind romance between her grandparents, how they met and the decision to create a life together, against the backdrop of war.

results.title: My university challenge
results.creator_credit: Ray Martin, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Ray Martin and his girlfriend enrolled in a university course in Thailand to become qualified English teachers. It was here that Martin set himself a challenge that not many people had been successful at achieving.

results.title: 2007 Lantern Parade
results.creator_credit: Paul Bray, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Paul Bray talks about the beauty of the Lantern Parade, an event he has participated in since 2005. He considers the affect parades have on the community and the collective sense of joy and wellbeing.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Bray, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
